titles.title: Agricultural Export Program Protection Act of 1993

A bill to amend the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to improve monitoring of the domestic uses made of certain foreign commodities in order to ensure that agricultural commodities exported under agricultural trade programs are entirely produced in the United States, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S2111-2114)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to Subcommittee on Domestic and Foreign Marketing.

committee.name: Senate Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry
committee.subcommittee: Domestic and Foreign Marketing and Product Promotion

bill.summary: 2/25/1993--Introduced. Agricultural Export Program Protection Act of 1993 - Amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to require specified foreign agricultural commodities imported into the United States to carry an end-use certificate. Subjects a person using foreign agricultural commodities in a U.S. agricultural trade program to program suspension or debarment.
